question: Question_Section_201_06_(c)
statement:
Consider the same graph as in the
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/April_2013/Question_Section_201_05_(a)}{previous
question}, now interpreted as an internet where the vertices represent
web pages and the arrows represent links.

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\includegraphics[width=.5\textwidth]{MATH307April2013Section201Q6.png}
\end{description}

\textbf{(c)} Starting with equal probabilities for each page, what are
the probabilities of being on each page after one step (with \emph{α =
1/2})? Based on this calculation, which page has the highest rank?
